articles.title: Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Erected at Mansudae Art Studio of DPRK
articles.content:
Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Erected at Mansudae Art Studio of DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il riding on horses together were erected at the Mansudae Art Studio with approach of the Day of the Shining Star.
					Their construction, the first of its kind in the history of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean revolution, is a great glory and pride of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea.
					
					A ceremony of unveiling the statues took place on Tuesday.
					
					Present there were senior party, state and army officials Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop and Kang Sok Ju, officials of party, military and power bodies, social organizations, ministries and national institutions, men and officers of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, officials and employees of the Studio and working people in the city of Pyongyang.
					
					Senior officials of the party, state and army and officials of the studio unveiled the statues.
					
					Laid at the statues is a floral basket from Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the WPK and the people and KPA supreme commander. 
					
					Placed were floral baskets in the name of the WPK Central Committee, the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, the DPRK Cabinet, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, units of the KPA and party and power organs in the city.
					
					The participants made bows to the statues.
					
					Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and president of the Presidium of the SPA, made an address at the ceremony.
					
					It was the unanimous desire and ardent wish of all the Party members, servicepersons and people to erect a statue of Kim Jong Il as well as Kim Il Sung's in order to hand down for all ages the prominent traits and revolutionary feats of the illustrious great man, the speaker said, adding: This ardent desire has been realized thanks to Kim Jong Un's boundlessly noble loyalty and meticulous guidance.
					
					He called for glorifying the revolutionary careers and undying feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il forever with the immutable faith that they are always with us.
					
					The participants looked round the statues after being briefed on them.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Congratulates Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Congratulates Kim Jong Un
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un Tuesday received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps here on the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery E. Sukhinin, doyen of the corps, conveyed the basket and letter to DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun. 
					
					Meanwhile, Kim Jong Un received floral baskets, congratulatory letters and gifts from the diplomatic envoys of Nigeria,  Egypt, Cambodia, the charge d'affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy, the Mongolian embassy, the missions of the WHO, the World Food Programme and the United Nations Children's Fund and the UNDP and the Economic Cooperation Bureau of Libya here.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Foreign Embassy Officials
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Foreign Embassy Officials
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un was presented with a floral basket and congratulatory letter by officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations of foreign embassies here on the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					They were conveyed to an official concerned by Malaysian Councilor Roselin Bin Rajab on Tuesday.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Delegations of Int'l Organizations
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Delegations of Int'l Organizations
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received floral baskets and congratulatory letters from delegations of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) working in the DPRK on the threshold of the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The baskets and letters were separately handed to an official concerned Tuesday by Jim Charles Dawe, acting head of the International Federation delegation, and Jean Jacques Putallaz, head of the ICRC delegation.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception to Commemorate Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception to Commemorate Day of Shining Star
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery Sukhinin arranged a reception at his embassy on Tuesday to commemorate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Present there on invitation were Kim Ki Nam and Kim Yong Il, secretaries of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Ri Yong Chol, vice department director of the C.C., WPK, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned.
					
					Staff members of the Russian embassy were on hand.
					
					The participants watched Korean documentary film "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il Paid Unofficial Visit to Siberian and Far East Regions of Russia" August 20-25, Juche 100 (2011).
					
					Valery Sukhinin said in his speech that the visit paid by Kim Jong Il to Russia greatly contributed to boosting the bilateral relations in various fields.
					
					He wished the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on a new stage under the leadership of Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un.
					
					He expressed belief that the Korean people would register new greater successes in building a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					Kim Ki Nam in his speech referred to the undying feats Kim Jong Il performed in the development of traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Russia. 
					
					He expressed belief that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would grow stronger by joint efforts this year.
					
					The lofty august name of Kim Jong Il and his image like the sun will shine for all ages and he is always alive in the hearts of the Korean people and mankind, he stressed. 
					
					A reception was given by the Russian consulate-general in Chongjin on the same day.

articles.title: Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy by Myanmar Political Party
articles.content:
Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy by Myanmar Political Party
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Union Solidarity and Development Party, Union of Myanmar sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Nay Pyi Taw on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Win Maung Kyaw, executive member of the Nay Pyi Taw Regional Committee of the Party, and his party visited the DPRK embassy on Feb. 9. They laid a floral basket and bowed before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Kimjongilia Festival Venue
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Kimjongilia Festival Venue
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps and the officials of foreign embassies in charge of cultural and friendly relations here visited the venue of the 16th Kimjongilia Festival on Tuesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					They viewed the immortal flowers which came to full bloom with boundless reverence of the Korean people and the world progressives for Kim Jong Il, peerlessly great man and brilliant commander of Songun.
					
					The members of the military attaches corps also visited the Pyongyang Cultural Exhibition on the same day.

articles.title: Foreigners Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Foreigners Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and his party and a delegation of the Japan Society for Study of Kim Jong Il's Works laid floral baskets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Ryongnam Hill Tuesday.
					After laying the baskets, they paid tribute to him.

articles.title: Foreigners Arrive
articles.content:
Foreigners Arrive
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party, and a delegation of the Japan Society for Study of Kim Jong Il's Works led by Advisor of the National Liaison Council of the Society Masaji Ie arrived here by air on Tuesday on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Delegation of GFTUK Comes back from South Africa
articles.content:
Delegation of GFTUK Comes Back from South Africa
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Association of Trade Unions of Korea came back home Tuesday after taking part in the meeting of the Presidential Council of the World Federation of Trade Unions in South Africa. 
					Choe Han Chun, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, headed the delegation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wild Honey to Pyongyang Maternity Hospital
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wild Honey to Pyongyang Maternity Hospital
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un sent lots of wild honey to the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Kim Jong Il used to send wild honey, tonics and modern medical equipment to it every year.
					
					Wild honey sent to the hospital on 56 occasions amount to some 140 tonnes.
					
					The medical workers and women in childbed were deeply moved by the benevolence of Kim Jong Un who carries forward Kim Jong Il's policy of loving the people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Shows Benevolence for Revolutionary Schools
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Shows Benevolence for Revolutionary Schools
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un sent a large quantity of foodstuffs to students and teachers of Kang Pan Sok Revolutionary School and Nampho Revolutionary School on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					On the lunar New Year's Day he visited Mangyongdae Revolutionary School and provided its students with gifts.
					
					This reflects his expectation that the children of revolutionary martyrs whom Kim Jong Il has take good care of while loving so much would stoutly grow to be the backbones and cores of the Songun revolution who will give a stead continuity to the traditions of Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Order of Kim Jong Il Awarded in DPRK
articles.content:
Order of Kim Jong Il Awarded in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A decision was made to award Order of Kim Jong Il to 132 persons, who rendered distinguished services in the efforts to build a thriving socialist nation and increase the national defence capabilities, on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Those winners included anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters, servicepersons, officials and working people.
					
					A decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on awarding the order was issued on Feb. 9.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Prize Awarded in DPRK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Prize Awarded in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A decision was made to award Kim Jong Il Prize to 24 persons who rendered distinguished services to socialist cultural construction of Juche on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il. They are  fully armed themselves with Kim Jong Il's idea and theory on Songun and performed distinguished feats in building socialist culture including science, education, literature and arts, media, public health and sports and thus greatly contributed to increasing the national strength, accelerating the building of a thriving socialist country and turning the DPRK into a developed, highly civilized state.
					A decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on conferring the prize was issued on Feb. 9.

articles.title: Commemorative Coins to Be Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
Commemorative Coins to Be Issued in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK will issue commemorative gold and silver coins "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il Will Always Be Alive" to commemorate the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					It is the unanimous will and desire of all service personnel and people to convey down to posterity the immortal feats he performed for the country, revolution, times and history, with the unshakable faith that he is always be with us.
					
					A decree on issuing the coins was promulgated by the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on Feb. 9.
					
					Kim Jong Il in jumper with a broad smile on his face is engraved in the center of the front side of the coins and its circumference has 70 points. Seen in their upper parts are letters "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il Will Always Be Alive" and in their lower parts letters "70th Birth Anniversary, 1942-2012" and their both sides are decorated with three magnolias. 
					
					Engraved in relief in the center of their backs are the old home of Kim Jong Il in the Paektusan secret camp against the background of Jong Il Peak and given there are their purities and weights. Seen in their upper parts are letters "Central Bank of DPRK" and in their lower parts the year of their issue. 
					
					The pure gold coin is 35mm in diameter and 2mm in thickness while pure silver coin is 40mm in diameter and 3mm in thickness.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize Conferred in DPRK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize Conferred in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A decision was made to award Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize in the DPRK on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The prize went to 104 youth league officials and members who have contributed to strengthening the league organizations into glorious Songun young vanguard ranks shining with the august name of President Kim Il Sung, performed feats in defending the country and building a thriving socialist nation and distinguished themselves in study and organizational life.
					
					A decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on conferring the prize was issued on February 9.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Children Honor Prize Awarded to Model Children Union Members in DPRK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Children Honor Prize Awarded to Model Children Union Members in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) --A decision was made to award Kim Jong Il Children Honor Prize to exemplary members of the Korean Children's Union on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The prize went to 101 KCU members who have distinguished themselves in studying and union organizational life, socio-political activities and do-good-thing movement.
					
					A decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on awarding the prize was issued on Feb. 9.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Commemorated in DPRK
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Commemorated in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The art squad of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League gave a performance at the Central Youth Hall on Tuesday to commemorate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star).
					The performance started with small chorus "The General Is Immortal as Sun" and "Snow-Covered Old Home".
					
					In Oungum ensemble "Where Are You, Dear General?", an immortal classic work, female solo "The General's Footstep Sound" and other numbers, the performers sang of strong yearnings for Kim Jong Il.
					
					Dialogic poem "We Held Kim Jong Il in High Esteem in Our Hearts", small chorus "Footsteps" and "The Korean Youth March" showed well the pledge of the Korean young people to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem for all ages and dynamically advance under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: 16th Kimjongilia Festival Opens
articles.content:
16th Kimjongilia Festival Opens
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The 16th Kimjongilia Festival opened with due ceremony here on Tuesday to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					On display in the festival venue are more than 30 000 potted flowers in praise of the great man, which came to full bloom with warm sincerity of the Korean people and world people ardently missing and revering Kim Jong Il.
					
					Among them are the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, units of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, the Secretariat of the Cabinet, the State Academy of Sciences, the Ministry of Light Industry, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Land and Marine Transport, servicepersons, working people from all walks of life and school youth and children. They also include the Central Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, diplomatic missions of different countries and missions of international organizations here, friendship organizations and personages of different countries and Chinese residents in the DPRK.
					
					Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Yong Nam, Kim Ki Nam and officials of military and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons, working people, overseas compatriot delegations and compatriots.
					
					Chairman of the Korean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee Kim Chang Do made an address.

articles.title: School Youth and Children's Festival of Loyalty Opens in DPRK
articles.content:
School Youth and Children's Festival of Loyalty Opens in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The 18th National Festival of Loyalty of School Youth and Children opened with due ceremony at the Central Youth Hall here on Tuesday. 
					The festival, which is to start on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il and last until the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, will be held divided into political, economic, art and sports festivals. 
					
					Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the C.C., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, made an opening address.

articles.title: Vegetable Decorations for Dishes
articles.content:
Vegetable Decorations for Dishes
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A national cooking competition was held at the Changgwangsan Hotel with the approach of the Day of the Shining Star (February 16), the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Vegetable decorations for dishes drew the attention of the attendants.
					
					Cooks from the General Bureau of Public Service and other public catering establishments presented vegetable decorations of different shapes and colors and unique themes.
					
					The vegetable decoration themed "Dolphins on Rungna Islet" shows the dolphin aquarium now being erected as another edifice in the Songun (military-first) era, two dolphins performing dexterous feats, a seagull skittering over waves and scenery of the River Taedong.
					
					"Home of Happiness" portraying peacocks in a garden was also highly appreciated in the competition. 
					
					"Treasure in the East Sea of Korea", "Rich Potato Harvest in Taehongdan" and "Golden Mountain in Autumn" give a vivid representation of natural scenery and animals.
					
					Materials used in the decorations were pumpkin, radish, cucumber and other vegetables and fruits.

articles.title: Ice Sculpture Festival Goes on in DPRK
articles.content:
Ice Sculpture Festival Goes on in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- An ice sculpture festival for commemorating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il is now under way in Samjiyon County, Ryanggang Province of the country, on Sunday.
					More than 1 000 ice sculptures are on display in the area of the Paektusan secret camp and the county seat. They were created by members of the Ministry of People's Security group under the 618 Construction Shock Brigade and inhabitants of the county.
					
					Among the sculptures in the area of the Paektusan secret camp are those depicting large floral basket, celebrating lantern, and the Korean people in bitter grief at the loss of the father of the nation, which vividly show the kinship between the leader and his people. 
					
					There are also a green pine on Nam Hill and two pistols reflecting the faith and will of the army and people to surely accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche started in Mt. Paektu, the Marshal star on the Supreme Commander's flag and a tiger of Mt. Paektu.
					
					The visitors are moved to see ice sculptures representing the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Party Founding Memorial Tower, the Arch of Triumph, the Three Charters for National Reunification Memorial Tower, falls of vinalon being churned out, Juche iron, Ryongrim Dam at the Huichon Power Station, etc. 
					
					Among those displayed in the Samjiyon County seat are sculptures depicting the Paektu plateau turned into potato-producing land, reminding the visitors of the history of devoted services of leader Kim Jong Il. There are also ice bridges, animals, plants and basin of chars.
					
					Various kinds of flood-light projectors were introduced for maximum effect of those exhibits, thus adding to the festive mood.

articles.title: Preparations for International Figure Skating Festival Finished
articles.content:
Preparations for International Figure Skating Festival Finished
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Preparations for the 21st International Figure Skating Festival for Paektusan Prize to be held in Pyongyang have come to an end.
					The Ice Rink is well decorated to host the festival, with litters "Independence", "Peace" and "Friendship" conspicuous in the venue.
					
					Korean figure skaters are training hard for the festival in the ice rink.
					
					Right before passing away, leader Kim Jong Il watched their demonstrations and promised good figure skates to them. They are preparing for the festival with ardent yearning for him.
					
					They will represent his great feats and lofty traits in the festival.
					
					Jong Sol Mi, a female player of the Pyongyang Railway Bureau Sports Team, told KCNA that she would be very happy to participate in the festival, putting on a pair of figure skates associated with his warm love.
					
					Kim Yong Ho, deputy secretary general of the Figure Skating Association of the DPRK, said that every demonstration would reflect the strong will of the Korean people to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem forever.
					
					The festival will bring together famous figure skaters from China, Russia and other countries.
					
					It will be held from February 15 to 17 to mark the Day of the Shinning Star (February 16), the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Poems Created in DPRK to Mark Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Poems Created in DPRK to Mark Day of Shining Star
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Korean poets have created many works with the approach of the Day of the Shining Star, leader Kim Jong Il's birthday (February 16.)
					An epic "Comrade Kim Jong Il, Eternal Sun of Songun" tells great feats performed by him in turning the DPRK into a nuclear state, a Songun (military-first) power. 
					
					It mirrors the people's ardent yearning for the leader, who devoted his whole life to them and successfully ensured the continuity of the revolutionary cause. 
					
					Another epic "We Are People of General Kim Jong Il" gives a vivid representation of the Korean people's pledge to carry forward the cause of the Songun revolution under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Among the new works are words of songs "General Is with People", "We Always Remember General" and "Our Day of Shining Star."

articles.title: Singing Gathering of Chinese Residents in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Singing Gathering of Chinese Residents in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Chinese residents in Pyongyang held a remembrance singing gathering at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club Tuesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					At the gathering performers expressed reverence of the Chinese residents for Kim Jong Il in such numbers as chorus "Song of General Kim Jong Il", an immortal revolutionary hymn, narration and chorus "General Is Our Father", female chorus "We Ardently Long for You".
					
					The number also included narration and choruses "Footsteps" and "We Pledge" that represented the Korean people's will to translate into brilliant reality the behests of Kim Jong Il under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, another brilliant commander born of Heaven.
					
					Present at the gathering were officials of the C.C., Association of Chinese Residents in Korea, Chinese residents in the city of Pyongyang and officials of the Pyongyang City People's Committee.

articles.title: Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions Closed
articles.content:
Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions Closed
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The 17th Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions came to close with due ceremony at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street here on Tuesday.
					In the contest divided into four groups its participants competed in nine events. 
					
					Taking the first place in the men's basketball event were the Ministry of Railways, Academy of Social Sciences, Taesong Guidance Bureau and the General Bureau of Diplomatic Corps Affairs and in the women's basketball the State Planning Commission, Myohyang Guidance Bureau and the General Bureau of Diplomatic Corps Affairs. Placed first in the men's volleyball event were the Educational Commission, Kumsong Youth Publishing House, Kumgang Guidance Bureau and the Foreign Trade Bank and in the women's volleyball the Central Bank, Publication Guidance Bureau, General Bureau for Service for People and the General Bureau of Diplomatic Corps Affairs and in the table tennis event the Ministry of Food Procurement and Administration, Academy of Social Sciences, General Bureau for Service for People and the Foreign Trade Bank.
					
					Winners of the groups in total standing were the Central Bank, Academy of Social Sciences, General Bureau for Service for People and the General Bureau of Diplomatic Corps Affairs.

articles.title: Posters Showing Militant Spirit of KPA Produced in DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Dismisses Rubbish in S. Korean Paper
Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The south Korean reptile paper Chosun Ilbo recently let loose a spate of invectives about the local performance tour made by the Unhasu Orchestra, the DPRK's renowned art troupe.
					Having no elementary understanding of the mass-based art, this paper echoed what was aired by Radio Free Asia engaged in the anti-DPRK smear propaganda. It claimed that "the performance was not received well by audience" and "it brought them burden rather than pleasure".
					
					This was wicked elements' trumpeting aimed at doing harm to the single-minded unity of the party and people.
					
					How can such human scum understand the people of the DPRK and its arts?
					
					Inspired by songs, the Korean people's 80 odd year-long just revolutionary struggle started, advanced and won victories. 
					
					The Korean revolution and people held aloft the banner of "Let's always be cheerful although our path is thorny!", the banner of confidence and optimism, during the Arduous March, the forced march.
					
					In this glorious course, songs and arts in the DPRK have served as valuable ideological and moral pabulum for the people making revolution that a large quantity of food can hardly substitute.
					
					Even after the loss of the father whom the Korean people deeply trusted and followed, they drew a thousand-fold strength and courage from the songs presented by the orchestra after the start of the advance in the new year. It is setting the hearts of people afire with reverence for the leader in various parts of the country. Its performances evoked a lively response among audience as they helped consolidate the unity between the leader and the people and aroused among them ardent longing for him. 
					
					The service personnel and people of the DPRK joined the orchestra in singing songs in tears and rose up, inspired by them. What the above-said media asserted is nothing but a shriek of despair made by those taken aback by the might of the arts, the hot wind raised by the orchestra more powerful than a nuclear bomb. 
					
					The reptile paper, a mixture of the American style and Japanese way of life, can never understand the true character and value of the DPRK's arts.
					
					They were so displeased with its local performance tour that they claimed it was unprofitable, the absurd assertion of a merchant. This suffices to guess their level of knowledge about arts.
					
					The smear campaign made by Chosun Ilbo and Radio Free Asia was manipulated by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors and the Intelligence Service.
					
					No matter how desperately the Lee's group work to hurt the single-minded unity of the DPRK, it is as foolish an act as running its head against a wall.
					
					Miserable, indeed, is the position of the Lee's group keen to prolong its remaining days as politicians through escalated confrontation with compatriots.

articles.title: Collection of Reminiscences Off Press in DPRK
articles.content:
Collection of Reminiscences Off Press in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Vol. 70 of "Glorifying the Era of Juche", a collection of reminiscences, was brought out in the DPRK on the threshold of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					This book had been compiled to present him on his 70th birthday.
					
					Contained in it are 22 reminiscences dealing with his immortal leadership feats.
					
					The first volume of the collection came to being on Aug. 10, 1976, and 13 656 000 copies of it in 70 volumes have been released since then.
					
					The 70 volumes of the collection contain 1 126 reminiscences written by 1 143 people of different strata who were honored with audience of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Young Koreans Pledge Loyalty for Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Young Koreans Pledge Loyalty for Kim Jong Un
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Young people of the DPRK Tuesday met in Kim Il Sung Stadium to pledge loyalty to the dear respected Kim Jong Un in the run-up to the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Speeches followed a report by Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					
					The reporter and speakers said Kim Jong Il was born in Mt. Paektu, a holy mountain of revolution, being possessed of all personalities and qualities as befitting a great man. He wisely led the army and people of the DPRK till the last moments of his life, thereby performing undying feats on behalf of the era and history, they added.
					
					They recalled that the fatherly General strengthened the league into the ranks of vanguard going with the august name of President Kim Il Sung and wisely led it so that it can creditably fulfill its mission and role as reliable political reserves of the Party.
					
					They called upon all youths to uphold Kim Jong Il as an eternal sun of Songun Korea for all ages and materialize his lifelong desire.
					
					They vowed to take the lead in the drive for realizing the Workers' Party of Korea's strategy for the prosperity of the country upholding the flame of Hamnam (South Hamgyong Province), keeping in mind his priceless aphorism that youths are prime-movers who make the whole country alive.
					
					They appealed to hold high the torch of revolution bequeathed by Kim Jong Il and be loyal to Kim Jong Un and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche, the cause of Songun revolution, loudly singing "Korean Youth March".
					
					Attending the meeting were Choe Thae Bok, Choe Ryong Hae, officials concerned and those of the youth league and youth and students here. 
					
					Similar meetings took place in each city and county of the DPRK.

articles.title: Men's Socks Workshop Commissioned in DPRK
articles.content:
Men's Socks Workshop Commissioned in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Ultra-modern men's socks production process has been furnished at the Pyongyang Hosiery Factory.
					This process, as well as the women's socks workshop whose production is fully automated at the highest level on the basis of the latest science and technology, will drastically raise the production capacity of the factory, thus greatly contributing to the improvement of the people's standard of life.
					
					A ceremony of putting it into operation took place on Tuesday.

articles.title: Clove Composite Bacillus Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Clove Composite Bacillus Developed in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The State Bacilli-Culture Institute of the State Academy of Sciences has developed clove composite bacillus.
					The bacillus is used in the foodstuff industry.
					
					It, consisting of various lactic bacteria, helps maintaining resistance to diseases and promoting growth.
					
					It also generates anticancer and adjuvant substances, promote digestion and absorption of nutrients and lower cholesterol in blood.
					
					It is efficacious for cerebral and cardiovascular diseases, digestive trouble, inflammatory disease, liver trouble and other diseases.
					
					The bacillus is applied to producing functional health drinks and foodstuffs like kamju (sweet drink prepared with rice and malt), bean kefir and yogurt at foodstuff factories.
					
					It is also applicable to preparing kimchi, pickling vegetables with a small amount of salt, making instant soybean malt and soft bean curd and growing bean sprouts.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams Stepped-up Moves for U.S.-Japan-S. Korea Military Alliance
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams Stepped-up Moves for U.S.-Japan-S. Korea Military Alliance
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S., Japanese and south Korean military authorities in recent closed talks on Jeju Island called for "maintenance of close system for sharing information of the north" and "regular" talks, while talking about the "provocation" of someone. 
					This is part of the U.S. strategy toward Asia which envisages putting military pressure on the DPRK and containing powerful neighbors through the establishment of triangular military alliance.
					
					The "information sharing" and "regular talks" aim tightened "tripartite cooperation", an expression of their stepped-up moves to form triangular alliance for aggression.
					
					The joint operational scenario is already in place among the three parties and the military operation commanding system of armed forces has been coordinated. The operation of information sharing system would be ill-boding under this situation.
					
					There is no doubt that its immediate target is the DPRK.
					
					The U.S. seeks to ignite a war on the Korean Peninsula in a bid to realize its domination strategy toward Asia and Korea.
					
					It has amassed armed forces for aggression in south Korea and its surrounding areas to launch military operation against the DPRK any moment and regularly staged military drills to round off the preparations for war. 
					
					The U.S. plan is to put the Asia-Pacific region under its control through the triangular military alliance. Japan is also mulling becoming the "leader" of Asia by taking advantage of the U.S. aggression Asia strategy.
					
					The international community should heighten vigilance against the aggression forces' desperate moves in the Asia-Pacific region, a region drawing big attention of the world forces.

articles.title: Dialogue and Confrontation Are Incompatible: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Dialogue and Confrontation Are Incompatible: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors are loudly claiming that it is to open "dialogue."
					Following the publication of open questionnaire by the DPRK, the riff-raffs of the puppet authorities of south Korea bluffed that they "would constantly signal the north that a door is open for dialogue" and they "hope the north would respond with sincerity to the south's efforts for resuming dialogue."
					
					These are no more than rhetoric of human scum.
					
					The Lee group is wicked confrontation maniacs with no justification to talk about dialogue.
					
					As soon as he took Chongwadae office, Lee put up "no nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars", a scenario for confrontation with fellow countrymen, as the "policy toward the north". He plunged the inter-Korean dialogue which had been brisk since the publication of the June 15 joint declaration, into a complete deadlock, saying "he would not have dialogue with the north unless it scraps its nukes and opens itself to the world."
					
					Whenever opportunities for dialogue were provided thanks to the DPRK's sincere efforts, the group of traitors spoiled them and rubbed salt into the wounds of the fellow countrymen. It insulted the Korean people who shed tears mourning the great loss to the nation.
					
					These worst evils and confrontation maniacs are impudently calling for "dialogue", a challenge and crime against the DPRK.
					
					The Lee group is getting unprecedented in staging war exercises against the DPRK and kicking up confrontation racket while paying lip-service to "dialogue."
					
					It toured the area along the Military Demarcation Line to slander the DPRK as "the most bellicose forces" and whip up confrontation consciousness among soldiers.
					
					It is planning to stage, together with the U.S. imperialists, large-scale Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises, drills for a war of aggression against the DPRK which still grieves over the great loss to the nation.
					
					This has created acute military tensions.
					
					The U.S. and Lee group are the arch criminals wrecking peace and escalating tensions on the peninsula and chieftains ruining the north-south ties and dialogue.
					
					It is illogical for the confrontation maniacs to call for dialogue while staging a war of aggression.
					
					Confrontation and dialogue can not go with each other.
					
					Lurking behind their claim for "dialogue" is a sinister intention to mislead the public and thus evade the responsibility for the stalled north-south relations and elicit support for general election.
					
					The double-dealing trick of the Lee group clearly proves that the dialogue and peace claimed by it precisely mean confrontation and war.
					
					What remains to be done is to settle accounts with those confrontation maniacs, enemy of the nation, who always hatch plots to do harm to the compatriots.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Rejects U.S. Advertisement about "Threat" from DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Rejects U.S. Advertisement about "Threat" from DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Michael Turner, chairman of the Strategic Forces' Sub-committee of the Armed Services Committee of the U.S. House of Representatives, recently stood against the planned reduction of the defense budget, asserting that the nuclear and missiles of the DPRK are a big "threat" to the U.S. Trent Frank, a lawmaker of the Armed Services Committee, too, gave an alarm to the DPRK, talking about "possible attack by super electromagnetic wave".
					Commenting on this fact, a news analyst of Rodong Sinmun Tuesday said: 
					
					The advertisement of the U.S. warlike forces about "threat" from the DPRK is aimed to isolate the DPRK politically, suffocate economically and stifle militarily even with use of nukes. 
					
					The DPRK has never posed a nuclear threat to anyone. 
					
					Such threat is given to the DPRK and other countries by the U.S. 
					
					"Dangerous countries", designated by the U.S. warmongers, are anti-imperialist independent countries going against the U.S. grain. 
					
					The U.S. war hawks are preoccupied by extreme nuclear delusion. 
					
					The U.S. can produce and use nukes as it pleases, but other countries should neither develop nukes nor possess nuclear deterrence against its nuclear threat. This is the U.S. nuclear logic.
					
					The U.S. has no qualification and face to talk about "threat" from the DPRK as it is the main culprit in creating nuclear arms race and disturbing the world peace and security.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls S. Korean Authorities' Claim for "Dialogue" Merely Cosmetic
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls S. Korean Authoritiesâ€² Claim for 'Dialogue' Merely Cosmetic
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative authorities' repeated claim that they are open to "dialogue" is aimed to hold the DPRK accountable for the stalled north-south ties. It is also aimed to cover up its true colors as the very one which put the dialogue in total stalemate, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a bylined commentary.
					South Korea is shameless enough to pervert the facts behind the stalled inter-Korean ties, says the commentary, adding:
					
					If the south Korean authorities are sincere in their hope for the resumption of the dialogue with the DPRK, they should reflect on their hostile acts and make a switchover in the confrontation policy.
					
					The "dialogue" claimed by them is just aimed to deflect public criticism and elicit support for the upcoming "parliamentary elections", not to improve north-south ties.
					
					It is ridiculous for them to speak loudly of "dialogue" in public as they refused to sit at the table with the DPRK in the past.
					
					It is also unreasonable to claim "dialogue" while planning another round of a rehearsal for war.
					
					It is clear that military exercises can never go together with dialogue. Talks in the middle of war drills will naturally end up in a quarrel.
					
					The Lee Myung Bak group's call for "dialogue" can win no one's sympathy.

articles.title: 2011 Int'l Games in Spotlight of Korean Sports Fans' Attention
articles.content:
2011 Int'l Games in Spotlight of Korean Sports Fans' Attention
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The football match between the DPRK and Japan topped the list of Korean sports fans' attention among international tournaments held in 2011.
					The DPRK and Japan, which belonged to Group C of the third-stage Asian regional preliminaries for the FIFA 2014 World Cup, met at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang on November 15.
					
					The DPRK won the match by dint of strong mental power and collectivism.
					
					A resident in Moranbong District, Pyongyang, Ri Chol Song (42), told KCNA that the noble sports spirit and excellent techniques displayed by the DPRK team admired all local people.
					
					Serbia's Nobak Jocovic defeated Spain's Rafael Nadal in the finals at the Wimbledon Tennis Championship.
					
					Jamaicans finished first in the 400-meter relay, trouncing Americans who had been the title winner.
					
					Russia's Yevgeniya Kanayeva snatched six gold medals at the World Rhythmic Gymnastics Championship and China's Sun Yang took the title in the 1 500-meter freestyle event at the World Swimming Championship, renewing the world record.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Suppression under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Suppression under Fire
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Jaju Minbo, internet newspaper of south Korea, on Feb. 10 posted an article condemning the suppression by the south Korean authorities reminiscent of the eve of war. 
					The article said:
					
					With the planned Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises approaching, the security forces have clamped down on members of social organizations and media persons, who waged actions for Korea's peaceful reunification. 
					
					The suppression aims at conducting those military exercises against the DPRK with ease.  
					
					Before the start of June 25 war, the Syngman Rhee "government" cooked up a case of media association, arresting and killing a number of innocent people. 
					
					The present authorities, finding it impossible to openly execute anti-war forces as before, are intensifying suppression on the charge of violation of the "Security Law". 
					
					These maneuvers can never be allowed as they are aimed to wipe out anti-war forces in advance for the stability of the rear before war.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Suppression of Progressive Organizations Slammed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Suppression of Progressive Organizations Slammed
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) stroke out at the authorities for cracking down on progressive organizations.
					In a statement on Feb. 9, the South Headquarters accused the group of having searched the office of Jaju Minbo and walked off Representative Ri Chang Gi in the wake of suppressing the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification on charges of violating "Security Law".
					
					The statement described the group's suppression as hysteria intended to hide its crimes and divert the public criticism.
					
					It also amounts to last-ditch efforts to head off the people's campaign to defeat the Lee Myung Bak "government" and the traitorous Grand National Party in the April general elections, says the statement.  
					
					The statement called for dealing a blow of justice to the Lee group so that it can no longer take office.

articles.title: Chongryon Central Standing Committee Gives Lecture
articles.content:
Chongryon Central Standing Committee Gives Lecture
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) gave a lecture at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on February 13 to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Present there were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, Ko Tok U, its vice-chairman, Pae Jin Gu, its vice-chairman and general secretary, the chairman of the Central Audit Committee of Chongryon, the advisor of the Research Institute on History of Korean Residents in Japan, department directors of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, leading officials of central organizations and enterprises of Chongryon and Chongryon officials in the Kanto area.
					
					The participants watched a video lecture "Our Immortal Father".

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Commemorated by Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Commemorated by Koreans in Japan
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Japan held meetings to commemorate the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					A meeting of officials of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan for laying Kimjongilia, the flower of sun, before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il took place at the Press Hall of Korea on Feb. 1.
					
					A seminar under the title "General Kim Jong Il, Sun of 21st Century" was held at the hall of Joson University on Feb. 8.
					
					The participants in the seminar heard the 15 papers including "The great General Kim Jong Il's plan for building a prosperous country is a succession to that of President Kim Il Sung" and "The great General Kim Jong Il performed leadership feats by formulating the Songun politics as basic political mode under socialism and firmly defending it".
					
					A meeting of the members of the Kumgang-san Opera Troupe to vow to implement the instructions of Kim Jong Il took place on Jan. 30.
					
					Meanwhile, football championship and relay race of Korean students in Japan for commemorating the Day of the Shining Star were held with splendor.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Published in Russia, Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Works Published in Russia, Nepal
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential For Accomplishing Socialism" was brought out in booklet by the Khabarovsk Territory Publishing House of Russia.
					The work, published on June 19, Juche 84 (1995), clarifies the idea that in order to successfully accomplish the socialist cause it is necessary to make the ideological work a key priority with a firm hold on it. It also says the basic task of the ideological work is to imbue the whole society with the socialist idea and that the ideological work should be conducted on the principle and method suited to the intrinsic requirements of socialism.
					
					His work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" was jointly published by the Nepali National Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the 70th Birth Anniversary of Leader Kim Jong Il and the Study Forum for Selfï¼Reliance of Nepal.
					
					The work, published on Sept. 5, Juche 97 (2008), expounds the idea that the invincible might of the DPRK lies in always defending and glorifying President Kim Il Sung's Juche-based idea and feats of state building.

articles.title: Nepali Papers on Kim Jong Il's Undying Feats and Patriotic Devotion
articles.content:
Nepali Papers on Kim Jong Il's Undying Feats and Patriotic Devotion
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Nepali papers carried special write-ups with photos of leader Kim Jong Il on his birth anniversary.
					Arpan carried an article titled "Undying feats in laying a springboard for a thriving nation" on Feb. 3. It said remarkable successes have been made in succession and the idea of building a thriving nation is coming true in the DPRK, a country that had to make the arduous march and the forced march just more than a decade ago. This is a striking demonstration of the leadership ability of Kim Jong Il, it noted.
					
					The signal events in the DPRK proved once again that his undying feats and patriotic devotion are the source of all victories and miracles and inexhaustible strength, it stressed.
					
					Jana Sata on Feb. 4 said the invincible might of the Korean People's Army would have been unthinkable without Kim Jong Il. He put forward the KPA as the pillar of the self-defence capabilities and made great efforts to strengthen it, the paper added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Idea and Feats Will Last Long: Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Idea and Feats Will Last Long: Nigerian Organization
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its Internet homepage articles on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					The Feb. 1 article titled "The great leader Kim Jong Il will always live" said:
					
					The Korean people turned out in a drive to implement the behests of Kim Jong Il, the father of the nation, after overcoming big grief over his loss. Kim Jong Il conducted energetic activities for the prosperity of the country and the people's welfare all his life.
					
					The Koreans are full of determination to hold him in high esteem forever and work just as intended by him with neither concession nor deviation in revolution.
					
					In Feb. 3 article titled "The great leader Kim Jong Il's idea and feats will last long" the homepage said:
					
					The Korean people are now deeply yearning for Kim Jong Il.
					
					They are hardening their pledge to build a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, while praising Kim Jong Il's undying feats for the country and mankind.
					
					Kim Jong Un is a genius of ideology and theory and peerless brilliant commander of Songun who is leading the revolution and construction to victory with the same idea and leadership mode as Kim Jong Il's.
					
					The sacred revolutionary history and undying feats of Kim Jong Il will shine long as there is Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Special Seminar in UK Marks Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
Special Seminar in UK Marks Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A special seminar on commemoration of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il was held in UK on Feb. 6.
					The participants paid respects to Kim Jong Il.
					
					Ella Rule, vice-chairman and international secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist), made a report.
					
					He said Kim Jong Il devoted his all to achieving the freedom and happiness of the Korean people, achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and realizing the human cause of independence till the last moments of his life.
					
					Kim Jong Il glorified the DPRK as a political, ideological and military power while shattering the moves of the imperialists to stifle the DPRK true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung, he noted.
					
					The Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) will adopt it as its policy to boost support and solidarity with the just cause of the Korean people, he stressed.
					
					The speakers praised Kim Jong Il for firmly defending Korean-style socialism at a time when the world socialist movement suffered serious setback due to the incidents in the Soviet Union and Eastern Europe later last century.
					
					His works serve as the precious ideological and theoretical assets for not only the Korean people but the world progressives. The works also provide eternal guidelines of the world socialist movement and the anti-imperialist actions, they stressed.
					
					They vowed to widely disseminate the works of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il not only within the party but among broad masses including the workers in the UK. 
					
					They expressed belief that the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people would register greater achievements in building a thriving socialist nation under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Revered by Official of International Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Revered by Official of International Organization
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Guy Dupre, secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea, said he came to revere leader Kim Jong Il, witnessing his untiring revolutionary activities, leadership mode and popular traits. The secretary general issued a statement on Feb. 6 on the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il.
					The constructive peace proposals and initiatives advanced by the DPRK clearly reflected his will to carry out President Kim Il Sung's instructions for national reunification, Guy Dupre said. Praising his feats for national reunification, Guy Dupre further said:
					
					Kim Jong Il was the people's father who devoted his all to building a thriving socialist nation and bringing happiness to the people.
					
					He was also a peerlessly brilliant commander who trained the Korean People's Army into a matchless army with his Songun politics.
					
					His untimely demise at the end of hard work for the Korean revolution and global independence was a great loss to not only the Korean people but the progressive mankind.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Marked Abroad
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star). A seminar and photo exhibition were held in Nepal, a seminar in Germany, an opening ceremony of the ten-day photo exhibition in Nigeria, round-table talks, film show and photo exhibition in Iran and an opening ceremony of Korean film week in Democratic Congo between Jan. 31 and Feb. 7.
					The chairman of the Nepali National Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the 70th Birth Anniversary of Leader Kim Jong Il in his speech said the birth of Kim Jong Il as the shining star over Mt. Paektu on Feb. 16, 1942 was the fortune for the Korean people and the world oppressed popular masses.
					
					The chairman of the Brandenburg State Committee of the Communist Party of Germany said at the seminar the decision of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK on instituting the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il as the Day of the Shining Star is an expression of the loyalty and noble obligation of the party, government and people of the DPRK for him.
					
					The Director of the Art and Cultural Council of the Ministry of Federal Capital Territory of Nigeria said at the ceremony that the African people will always remember the material and moral support rendered by Kim Jong Il for the building of new societies in developing countries, African countries in particular.
					
					Messages to the dear respected Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events in Nepal and Germany.

articles.title: Feats of Kim Jong Il Praised by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Feats of Kim Jong Il Praised by Foreign Papers
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers praised the undying feats by leader Kim Jong Il.
					The Bangladeshi paper Blits on February 1 carried the portrait of a smiling Kim Jong Il and praised him as a great thinker and theoretician, benevolent father of the people and peerless Songun brilliant commander possessed of extraordinary strategy and matchless pluck and courage.
					
					He comprehensively developed in depth the Juche idea and Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and firmly defended socialism by pursuing Songun politics, it noted.
					
					The Indonesian paper Suara Karya on February 8 said it was the goal and wishes of Kim Jong Il to build a thriving socialist nation where the people are well-off with nothing to envy in the world. 
					
					The Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer said Kim Jong Il already fully displayed his wisdom and stratagem and courage as a brilliant commander since he started his Songun revolutionary leadership by inspecting Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army.
					
					He defended the destiny of the motherland, people and socialism and ensured the peace and security of the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world later last century by holding aloft the banner of Songun, it added.
					
					The Guinean Renaissance Radio on February 4 in an article titled "Kimjongilia, reflection of fascination by the great man" introduced Kimjongilia festival that takes place in every February.

articles.title: Foreign Crewmen Praise Kim Jong Il's Exploits
articles.content:
Foreign Crewmen Praise Kim Jong Il's Exploits
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Crewmen of foreign ships met at the port of Chongjin in North Hamgyong Province of the country on Tuesday to commemorate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Present at the meeting were the captain and crewmen of the Panamanian-flagged ship "Ba He Chuan".
					
					Speakers there said that the birth of Kim Jong Il was a great fortune of the nation as it promised the rosy future of the Korean people. It was also a historic event that gave new hope to the progressive mankind, they added.
					
					They noted that Kim Jong Il devoted his all to accomplishing the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il, the sun of the 21st century, will be kept forever in the hearts of humankind, they said. 
					
					A letter to the dear respected Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.
					
					The participants laid bouquets before the statue of Kim Il Sung in Chongjin before paying tribute to him.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Military Drills Are Provocation against DPRK: Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Military Drills Are Provocation against DPRK: Swiss Organizations
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Swiss organizations slammed the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for planning to hold Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills. The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on Feb. 6.
					The joint drills are a great threat to the peace and stability not only of the Korean Peninsula but the Asia-Pacific region as they are part of operation drills for invading the DPRK like the precedent ones, the statement said.
					
					It is shameless for the U.S. imperialists and the Lee Myung Bak clique of south Korea to try to justify the planned drills as "defensive and normal ones", the statement said, adding: 
					
					It is sophism to call the U.S. forces present in south Korea "defenders" of the Korean land.
					
					The U.S. and south Korea plan the war rehearsal drills at a time when the Korean people are gearing up to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung while still grieving over the loss of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. This is an insult and provocation against the Korean people.
					
					The U.S. imperialists and the Lee Myung Bak clique are seriously mistaken if they think they can go scot-free while holding the criminal Key Resolve and Foal Eagle.

articles.title: Casualties of U.S. Forces Increase in Afghanistan
articles.content:
Casualties of U.S. Forces Increase in Afghanistan
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S. army in Afghanistan for "war on terrorism" is sustaining steady losses from continued attacks by the resistant forces.
					A total of 1 775 U.S. soldiers have been killed and 15 322 wounded as of Feb. 7 since the start of the Afghanistan war, according to a recent report of the U.S. Defense Department.

articles.title: Day of Victory of Islamic Revolution Marked in Iran
articles.content:
Day of Victory of Islamic Revolution Marked in Iran
Tehran, February 13 (KCNA) -- Iran marked the 33rd anniversary of the Islamic revolution on Feb. 11.
					A celebration meeting took place at Azadi Square in the capital city of the country.
					
					Present there were Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad and government officials together with masses of different strata.
					
					Speaking at the meeting, the president referred to the great achievements recently made in the political and economic fields of the country, the nuclear field in particular. The U.S. and the West are posing sanctions and military threat to Iran over its nuclear program but its people are triumphantly advancing toward the road chosen by themselves, he said.
					
					Though their anti-Iran moves are so persistent and vicious, they will never bring the Iranian people to their knees, he said.
					
					Chanting anti-U.S. slogans, the participants in the meeting expressed their full support for the government's stand to continue the peaceful nuclear program despite the enemies' obstruction.
					
					Celebration events took place also in different cities of Iran.

articles.title: Iran Not to Give in to West's Threats over Nuclear Case
articles.content:
Iran Not to Give in to West's Threats over Nuclear Case
Tehran, February 13 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali-Akbar Salehi on Friday said Iran would not give in to any threat by the Western countries over its nuclear program.
					"Our nation should know that the Islamic Republic of Iran takes these threats seriously and we are prepared in every respect and have plans for the worst case scenarios," he said.
					
					"We will take the required measures within the framework of our nuclear safeguards," Salehi said, adding that Iran would announce new nuclear achievements in the coming weeks.

articles.title: Iran Adds 2 Light Submarines to Naval Fleet: Navy Commander
articles.content:
Iran Adds 2 Light Submarines to Naval Fleet: Navy Commander
Tehran, February 13 (KCNA) -- Iran's Navy Commander Rear Admiral Habibollah Sayyari said Friday Iran's Navy added two domestically-manufactured light Ghadir-class submarines to its naval fleet.
					The submarines, completely designed and produced by Iranian experts, would enhance the Islamic Republic's naval capabilities, Sayyari was quoted as saying.

articles.title: Pakistani President Clarifies Stand to Promote Gas Pipeline Project with Iran
articles.content:
Pakistani President Clarifies Stand to Promote Gas Pipeline Project with Iran
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Pakistani President Asif Ali Zardari recently clarified the stand of the government to promote to the last a pipeline project for natural gas to be imported from Iran, dismissing the U.S. pressure.
					The U.S. is persistently opposed to this project, claming that it would bring benefit to Iran, but Pakistan will buckle down to it to meet its energy requirements, he said.

articles.title: Israel, U.S. Complete MD System Test
articles.content:
Israel, U.S. Complete MD System Test
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Israel and the United States recently completed a test of the joint U.S.-Israel Arrow Weapon System (AWS) over the Mediterranean Sea.
					They conducted a test of Arrow 3, a defense system designed to intercept and destroy ballistic missiles high in the atmosphere.
					
					The test is the last one before the delivery of AWS, according to a news report.

articles.title: Biting Cold and Heavy Snowfall Cause Rising Toll in Europe
articles.content:
Biting Cold and Heavy Snowfall Cause Rising Toll in Europe
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The persistent severe cold and heavy snowfall are raising the scope of damage in Europe.
					550 people were reported dead in Europe as of Feb. 12.
					
					The number of deaths in Romania and Italy increased to 65 and 53 respectively.
					
					Snowslide left nine people dead in Serbia and 11 Polish lost their lives due to the fire that they set to keep off biting cold.
					
					It was reported that the heavy snow brought schools and public institutions in Rome of Italy to closure and rain and sleet fell in most parts of the capital from the daytime of Feb. 10 when the daily life of citizens was put into confusion.
					
					Snow was registered 2 meters in a region of Montenegro and more than 1 meter in other regions. Podgorica witnessed the highest record of snowfall in 50 years. This forced the government of Montenegro to put the whole country on alert on Sunday.
					
					Meanwhile, ships' sailing was completely suspended in Austria, Hungary and Bulgaria.
					
					At present more than 100 000 people in mountainous regions of East Europe are reportedly leading a torturous life as they were cut off from the outside world by the inclement biting cold and heavy snow.

articles.title: Erguidas estatuas de bronce de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Erguidas estatuas de bronce de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia de la Estrella Luz (16 de febrero, dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il), fueron erguidas en la Casa de Creacion Mansudae las estatuas de bronce del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il cabalgando juntos.
					El levantamiento de las estatuas ecuestres unidas de ambos lideres, las primeras de este tipo en la historia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y la revolucion coreana, es un gran jubilo de la nacion de Kim Il Sung y la Corea de Kim Jong Il y un gran honor y orgullo del pueblo coreano.
					
					La ceremonia de develado tuvo lugar el dia 14.
					
					Participaron aqui los cuadros directivos del Partido, el Estado y el ejercito: Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop y Kang Sok Ju, los funcionarios de las instituciones del Partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, las organizaciones de masas, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, los funcionarios y empleados de la Casa de Creacion Mansudae junto con trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					Develaron las estatuas los funcionarios y hombres ameritados.
					
					Ante las estatuas fue depositado el cesto de flores enviado por Kim Jong Un, Maximo Dirigente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el pueblo y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					Luego, fueron colocados los cestos de flores en nombre del Comite Central del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC, las organizaciones de masas, ministerios, organos centrales y de los organos, fabricas, empresas y universidades en esta capital.
					
					Los participantes rindieron sublime homenaje al Presidente y al Dirigente.
					
					El discurso de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y presidente del Presidium de la APS de la RPDC.
					
					Dijo que transmitir para siempre las cualidades extraordinarias y hazanas revolucionarias de       Kim Jong Il, gran hombre sin par, construyendo su estatua junto con la del Presidente, fue el unanime anhelo de todos los militantes del partido, los oficiales y soldados del EPC y el pueblo coreano.
					
					Este deseo se llevo a la realidad gracias a la noble fidelidad y la minuciosa orientacion del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, senalo.
					
					Recalco que todos deben glorificar la vida revolucionaria e inmortales hazanas del Presidente y el Dirigente con la firme conviccion de que ellos viven siempre en el pueblo coreano.
					
					Los participantes escucharon explicaciones sobre las estatuas y dieron una vuelta a ellas.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia 3 toneladas de miel a la Casa de Maternidad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia 3 toneladas de miel a la Casa de Maternidad
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un envio gran cantidad de miel a la Casa de Maternidad de Pyongyang con motivo del dia de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					El Dirigente enviaba cada ano a este hospital la miel, los fortificantes, los modernos equipos medicos, entre otros. 
					
					La miel enviada por el Dirigente llega a mas de 146 toneladas en 56 ocasiones. 
					
					Los funcionarios medicos y las parturientas estan muy emocionados por esta benevolencia de Kim Jong Un quien continua el amor del Dirigente.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones del Cuerpo Diplomatico en Corea

Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones del Cuerpo Diplomatico en Corea
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un recibio un cesto de flores y carta de felicitacion que le dirigiera el Cuerpo Diplomatico acreditado en Corea con motivo del septuagesimo aniversario del natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: ACNC comenta los pasos para formar la alianza militar tripartita
articles.content:
ACNC comenta los pasos para formar la alianza militar tripartita
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- Hace poco, las autoridades de defensa nacional de EE.UU., Japon y el Sur de Corea sostuvieron en la isla surcoreana Jeju las conversaciones a puertas cerradas.
					En esa ocasion, hablaron sobre el "mantenimiento de un sistema de compartimiento de las informaciones sobre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea" pretextando la supuesta "provocacion" de alguien y abogaron por "regularizar" la cita.
					
					Este debate parte de la estrategia de EE.UU. sobre Asia consistente en ejercer la presion militar a la RPDC y disuadir a las potencias perifericas estableciendo la alianza militar tripartita.
					
					EE.UU. planea "mantener el sistema de compartimiento de informaciones" y "regularizar" las conversaciones de los titulares de defensa de los susodichos paises para estrechar la "cooperacion tripartita".
					
					Ya esta trazado el plan de operacion conjunta entre EE.UU., Japon y el Sur de Corea y las fuerzas armadas de estos paises establecen el sistema de mando unico de sus operaciones militares.
					
					Sin duda alguna, la RPDC es el primer blanco de esa alianza agresiva.
					
					EE.UU. intenta desatar la guerra en la Peninsula Coreana para poner en practica su estrategia dominacionista sobre Asia y la RPDC.
					
					Para ese fin, desplego enormes fuerzas agresoras en la linea avanzada del Sur de Corea y su contorno, de modo que ellas puedan cumplir en cualquier momento las operaciones militares anti-RPDC.
					
					Por otra parte, desarrolla una tras otra las maniobras militares para perfeccionar la disposicion para la guerra.
					
					EE.UU. intenta tomar el control de la region de Asia-Pacifico formando y operando la alianza militar tripartita mientras Japon pretende ser el "amo" de Asia tomando parte activa en el cumplimiento de la agresiva estrategia norteamericana sobre ese continente.
					
					La sociedad internacional debera redoblar la vigilancia a los aventureros movimientos de las fuerzas agresoras en la region de Asia-Pacifico que se convierte en el centro de las fuerzas del mundo.

articles.title: Dialogo y enfrentamiento son incompatibles-comentario de ACNC
articles.content:
Dialogo y enfrentamiento son incompatibles-comentario de ACNC
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- En estos dias, la banda del traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak se muestra mas afanosa en proponer el "dialogo".
					Despues de publicado el acta de interpelacion abierta de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, los fulanos y menganos de las autoridades titeres surcoreanas dicen unos disparates repugnantes como que "daran sostenidamente al Norte la senal de que esta abierta la puerta del dialogo" y "desean al Norte que responda con sinceridad a los esfuerzos de la parte Sur por reanudar el dialogo".
					
					La camarilla de Lee Myung Bak es la horda de connotados maniacos de enfrentamiento que no tiene derecho ni cara para hablar del dialogo.
					
					Tan pronto como tomo el poder, trazo en un cuarto recondito de "Chongwadae" la llamada "politica sobre el Norte" fundamentada en la teoria de enfrentamiento fratricida "desnuclearizacion, la apertura y 3 000 dolares".
					
					Rompio totalmente el dialogo intercoreano que se dinamizaba despues de la cumbre N-S en el 15 de Junio de 2000, diciendo que "no dialogaria con el Norte antes de que este renuncie sus armas nucleares y proceda a la apertura".
					
					Echo a perder las oportunidades de dialogo dadas por los esfuerzos sinceros de la RPDC al lanzar las campanas de enfrentamiento con esta e hirio doblemente a la poblacion norcoreana insultado sus lagrimas de sangre derramadas durante el gran duelo nacional (fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il).
					
					Sin embargo, esos maniacos de enfrentamiento hablan descaradamente del "dialogo", lo cual significa un desafio y crimen a la RPDC.
					
					La banda de Lee Myung Bak habla ahora del "dialogo" por una parte y por la otra, libra mas que nunca los ejercicios belicos y la campana conflictiva anti-RPDC.
					
					Deambulando por las zonas aledanas a la linea de demarcacion militar, difamo a la RPDC como "fuerzas mas belicosas" y sembro a los soldados el espiritu de confrontacion fratricida.
					
					Intenta librar junto con EE.UU. "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle", maniobras belicas de gran envergadura, colocando en la mirilla a los connacionales de la RPDC enlutados todavia. Por resultado, se crea en Corea el estado de agudas tensiones militares.
					
					Los que destruyen la paz y agravan la tension en la Peninsula Coreana y rompen las relaciones intercoreanas y el dialogo con la RPDC son precisamente EE.UU. y la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak.
					
					La confrontacion y el dialogo son incompatibles.
					
					El canturreo repentino del "dialogo" de esa camarilla parte de su siniestro intento de eludir la responsabilidad de la ruptura de las relaciones intercoreanas enganando la opinion publica y ganar votos de apoyo en las inminentes elecciones.
					
					Su conducta ambigua comprueba claramente que el dialogo y la paz aludidos por ella significan realmente la confrontacion y la guerra.
					
					Lo unico que queda pendiente en las relaciones con esos enemigos de la nacion es la consecuente liquidacion de las cuentas.
